description: From French r√¥tisserie. Doublet of rosticceria and roastery.

entries.meaning: A cooking device with which food is roasted on a rotating spit.
examples: Rotisseries are essentially self-basting because most of the juices stay on the meat and distribute across it while the rotisserie is being turned.

entries.meaning: A shop or restaurant selling food cooked in this manner.
examples: Restaurants, chop-houses, rotisseries, abound in every part[of San Francisco].

entries.meaning: (US, sports) Ellipsis of rotisserie baseball. Synonym of fantasy baseball
(US, sports) Ellipsis of rotisserie sports. Synonym of fantasy sports

verbs.description: rotisserie (third-person singular simple present rotisseries, present participle rotisserieing, simple past and past participle rotisseried)
